docs.snippet: A Florida woman and her two adult sons were killed in their Pensacola home in what investigators believe was a ritualistic murder linked to last week's "blue moon," police said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Florida woman and her two adult sons were killed in their Pensacola home in what investigators believe was a ritualistic murder linked to last week's "blue moon," police said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Florida Triple Murder May Have Been Ritualistic Killing: Police
headline.print_headline: Florida Triple Murder May Have Been Ritualistic Killing: Police

docs.snippet: Oregon agreed to pay $800,000 to settle a lawsuit brought by a student who claimed she was sexually assaulted last year by three basketball players....

headline.main: University of Oregon Settles Lawsuit Over Rape Allegations
headline.print_headline: University of Oregon Settles Lawsuit Over Rape Allegations

docs.snippet: Prosecutors released a surveillance video Tuesday showing suspects calmly leaving an apartment building where five people were found tortured and shot to death, including a photojournalist who had taken refuge in the capital after feeling threaten...
docs.lead_paragraph: Prosecutors released a surveillance video Tuesday showing suspects calmly leaving an apartment building where five people were found tortured and shot to death, including a photojournalist who had taken refuge in the capital after feeling threatened in the Mexican state he covered.

headline.main: Mexico Prosecutor: Video Has Suspects in Journalist Killing
headline.print_headline: Mexico Prosecutor: Video Has Suspects in Journalist Killing

docs.snippet: A jury in London found Tom Hayes guilty of conspiring to manipulate the global benchmark interest rate. He was sentenced to 14 years in prison....
docs.lead_paragraph: A jury in London found Tom Hayes guilty of conspiring to manipulate the global benchmark interest rate. He was sentenced to 14 years in prison.
docs.abstract: Former Citigroup and UBS trader Tom Hayes is convicted on eight counts of conspiring to manipulate Libor, global benchmark interest rate; is sentenced to 14 years in prison; Hayes is first person to go to trial on criminal charges in connection with Libor manipulation and case is significant for British authorities, have been criticized in United States for not pursuing financial crime as aggressively as Justice Dept.

headline.main: Former Citigroup and UBS Trader Convicted in Libor Case
headline.print_headline: Ex-Trader Is Convicted in Rate-Rigging Case
